comments:
Create a new shell and try to run it as a java bean.  Stack trace as follows:

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-win32-3132 in java.library.path
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1517)
	at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:788)
	at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:834)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:123)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.<clinit>(OS.java:18)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.<clinit>(Widget.java:69)
	at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:141)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.vce.launcher.remotevm.SWTLauncher.supportsLaunching(SWTLauncher.java:69)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.vce.launcher.remotevm.JavaBeansLauncher.main(JavaBeansLauncher.java:71)
Exception in thread "main"
This should be fixed/based on Bug 93401
Gili, is this bug dependent on bug 93401 being fixed? I don't see the connection.

Check the getVMArguments method in the JavaBeanLaunchConfigurationDelegate
class.  Looks like this might be assigning something regarding a specific swt
configuration.

The JavaBean launcher had hardcode contribution to the library and it is not
valid anymore.  We now have to support post/pre 3.1 library pkg. and reuse the
support now available with the SWTcontainer.  

Given that the SWT plugin is not available to the launcher, we need to use the
Configuration Contribution extention point to do so.
Jon, the only thing that is left is the reUse of the library contribution
SWT and RCP Launcher are both working now, checked into VE 1.1
